utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe, Chandler, and Ross are there, Rachel is serving brownies.]

utterances.transcript: Here you go Pheebs. Who else wants one of my special homemade brownies?
I will have one.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I will have one. (Ross and him both take one.)
(Phoebe takes a bite and spits it out and screams.)

utterances.transcript: Okay, I'm not gonna have one.
Neither will I.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Neither will I. (they both put back the brownies.)

utterances.transcript: No, no, it's just my tooth.
All right I'll have one.
utterances.transcript_with_note: All right I'll have one. (he and Ross take another brownie,)

utterances.transcript: So what's a matter, you need a dentist? I've got a good one.
No thanks, I have a good one too. I just, I, I can't see him.
See that is the problem with invisible dentists.
Why? Why can't you go to him?
Because, every time I go to the dentist, somebody dies.
That is so weird, because every time I go to the dentist, I look down the hygienist's blouse.
Phoebe, what? Umm...what?!
Yeah, yeah, first there was my aunt Mary, and then there was umm, John, my mailman, and then my, my cowboy friend 'Albino Bob'.
And all these people actually died?
Yes, while I was in the chair! That's why I take such good care of my teeth now, y'know, it's not about oral hygiene, I floss to save lives!
Pheebs, come on, you didn't kill anybody, these people just happened to die when you went to the dentist. It's, it's, it's just ah, a coincidence.
Well tell that to them. Oh! You can't, their dead.

utterances.transcript: Thanks, Gunther. Hey! Umm, can I get a napkin too?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (trying to bite into an apple) Ow! Ow! (drops the apple in disgust.)

utterances.transcript: Phoebe, your in pain, would you just go to the dentist, just go.

I promise.

Hey, is, is, is Chandler here?

utterances.transcript: No, no he's not.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (patting his clothes like he is looking for his wallet) No, no he's not.

What? So what are you going to do? I mean how, how are you going to tell Chandler?

utterances.transcript: Well, I was thinking about that and I, I think the best way would be, to not.
Joey, you can't keep this to yourself, if you know about this, you have to tell him.
It'll kill him. I mean it'll, it'll just kill him.
Well, you could wait 'til I go to the dentist, maybe I'll kill him.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The street, Chandler and Joey are walking past a jewelery store.]

utterances.transcript: Hey! Hold on a minute, hold on a second. Do you think these pearls are nice?
I'd really prefer a mountain bike.
Janice's birthday is coming up, I want to get her something speacial. Come in here with me.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, wait, whoa. Do you ah, want to get her something speacial, get her flowers, get her candy, get her gum, girls love gum.
That's a good idea, 'Dear Janice have a Hubba-Bubba birthday'. I would like to get her something serious.
Oh, you want something serious. Y'know what you should do, you should get her one of those um, barium enemas. Those are dead serious.
All right. Look, I'm gonna go in here, and you don't buy me anything ever.
utterances.transcript_with_note: All right. Look, I'm gonna go in here, and you don't buy me anything ever. (starts to go into the store)

utterances.transcript: No, no, you can't, you can't, okay, you can't, you can't buy her pearls, you just can't, you can't, you can't.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (stopping him) No, no, you can't, you can't, okay, you can't, you can't buy her pearls, you just can't, you can't, you can't.

utterances.transcript: Why not?!
Oh God. Uh, okay, here's the thing, this is the thing, okay, the thing is...
What is the thing?
Okay. I went down to the 'Mattress King' showroom and, and I saw Janice, kissing her ex-husband.
What?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (shocked) What?

utterances.transcript: They were in his office.
Well she, she wouldn't do that, she's with, she's with me.
I'm telling you man, I saw it.
Yeah, well, you're wrong! Okay, you're wrong.
I'm not wrong! I wish I was. I'm sorry. Bet that barium enema doesn't sound so bad now, huh?

I don't know, y'know. What, what, would you do?

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross has just finished putting Ben to sleep, and is entering from Rachel's room.]

utterances.transcript: Well, he's finally alseep. About that ah, bump on his head?
Are you, are you, are you sure it's ah, a new bump? I mean, no offense, I've always thought of Ben as a fairly bumpy headed child.
It's okay if he bumps his head, kids bump their heads all the time, y'know, it was your first time babysitting, I figured you did the best you could.
I did!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (confidently) I did!

utterances.transcript: I know! I'm saying you have to watch them all the time.
I did!! I watched! I watched! I watched Monica bang his head against that thing!
Monica did it?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Monica runs into the kitchen from the terrace.)

utterances.transcript: Monica?
Yeah.
Umm, did you notice anything wierd about Ben today?
No. Why?

Well, I was just playing with him, and y'know we were doing the alphabet song, which he used to be really good at, but suddenly he's leaving out 'e' and 'f.' It's like they just ah, I don't know, fell out of his head.
Really?!
Oh, and also, he's, he's walkin' kind of funny, his left leg is moving a lot faster than his right leg, and he's in there just sort of y'know...

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Janice are there.]

utterances.transcript: Janice, I have something I need to tell you, and I want you to let me get through it, because it's, it's, it's not gonna be easy.
Okay.

I think you should go back with Gary. I don't wanna be the guy that breaks up a family, y'know when my parents split up, it was because of that guy. Whenever I would see him I was always think y'know 'You're the reason, you are the reason why their not together.' and I hated that guy. And it didn't matter how nice he was, or how happy he made my Dad.
Wow!
Yeah, well. It's the right thing to do.

Oh! You're right. Oh God. But, before I can say 'good-bye', there's something I really need you to know, Chandler. The way I feel about you, it's like, I finally understand what Lionel Richie's been singing about. Y'know, I mean what we have, it's like movie love, you're my soulmate, and I can't believe we're not going to be spending the rest of our lives together.
Then don't leave me!
What?
Forget what I said, I was babbling! Pick me!
No, you were right, you were right. I mean, I-I-I've got to give my marriage another chance.
No you don't! No, no, no, I say you have to give your divorce another chance.
I'm sorry.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (standing up) I'm sorry. (hugs him)

utterances.transcript: Ohhh. Don't go.
No, I-I-I gotta go.
utterances.transcript_with_note: No, I-I-I gotta go. (she starts to walk away, but Chandler doesn't let her go.)

utterances.transcript: No. No! No! No!
Honey, honey, people are looking.
I don't care! I don't care!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I don't care! (turns around and to the people watching them) I don't care!!

utterances.transcript: Yeah, um, I'm, I'm leaving now.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, um, I'm, I'm leaving now. (tries to get her leg out of Chandler's grasp, she finally does, but Chandler takes off her shoe.)

utterances.transcript: You can't leave! I have your shoe!
Good-bye Chandler Bing.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Good-bye Chandler Bing. (walks out with one shoe)

utterances.transcript: Rachel has those in burgendy.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey, Rachel, Monica, Phoebe, and Ross are holding the giant poking device.]

utterances.transcript: All right now remember, something this big and long is going to be difficult to manuver, fortunately I have a lot of experience in that area.
Can we please focus here, a naked man's life hangs in the balance!
I'm telling you he's dead. What we are about to have here is a dead fat guy on a stick.
All right, ladies and gentlemen, let's poke. Steady. Steady. Okay, a little higher. Careful of the angle. Okay, okay, we're approaching the window Thread the needle. Thread the needle.
utterances.transcript_with_note: All right, ladies and gentlemen, let's poke. (they start to advance the giant poking device) Steady. Steady. Okay, a little higher. Careful of the angle. Okay, okay, we're approaching the window (as he says this the camera cuts to their view of Ugly Naked Guy, so that we actually see him!) Thread the needle. Thread the needle.
(They thread the needle and start poking him, he then stirs.)

utterances.transcript: He's alive! He's a-live!!!
And yet, we're still poking him.
Okay, retract the device, retract the device.
He does not look happy.
Hey-hey, now he's showing us his poking device.
Hey, that's never gonna make it all the way over here, buddy!
